page.title: 04EMPLOYMENT,SEASCALE/GOSFORTH
page.content: I found all these British Nuclear Fuels advertisements and articles in the Whitehaven News, because it is such a big, well known and important place. Most scholar's parents in this school work at Sellafield. Sellafield supports most sports and events in the community, as you can see in the advertisements. About the only setback with Sellafield is the discharging of waste. Several months ago, no-one was allowed on the beach because a small amount of radio active waste was discharged out of the pipeline into the sea. Harmless waste is dumped at Drigg. Sellafield produces electricity for most of Cumbria by splitting atoms. It also stores radio active waste. It is one of only about six factories in the world that does this.
